problem_text:
Yu. I. Merzlyakov (Sov. Math. Dokl., 19 (1978), 64–68) proved that if the complex numbers α, β, γ are each at least 3 in absolute value, then the matrices
( 1  α ; 0  1 ),
( 1  0 ; β  1 ), and
( 1 −γ ; −γ  γ  1 + γ )
generate a free group of rank three.
Are there rational numbers α, β, γ, each less than 3 in absolute value, with the same property?
Yu. V. Sosnovski˘ı
